MESSAGE:
𝗦𝘁𝗮𝗰𝗸𝗲𝗱 𝗟𝗶𝘃𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗜𝗻

in an HDB home, and that there are only about 284 HDB landed units, that makes this week’s home a really really rare one. Homeowners Grace and Wei Xiang (together with their dogs Truffle & Chanko) always knew that they wanted something different, and when they found this landed HDB home at Jalan Bahagia they knew that this was it. It’s a 2-storey landed unit, with about 1,000 square feet of built up space, and 1,400 square feet of land. 

They created a Japanese Zen garden in the front of their home by levelling out the whole porch, and it’s a really tranquil spot to sit and have a cup of tea. It’s certainly a really relaxing sight to see everything you get home.

𝗪𝗮𝘁𝗰𝗵 𝗡𝗼𝘄 ➡️ https://youtu.be/DTj3X10DSIg

𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗿𝘁𝘆 𝗣𝗶𝗰𝗸𝘀

If you're in the market for a 2-bedroom new launch unit, you're probably familiar with the kitchen running along the wall in an open fashion. Considering the limited amount of space, those looking for enclosed kitchen options in such units may find it a rarity. In this article, we look at 6 such 2-bedroom new launch units that feature enclosed kitchens as part of their offering.

𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗮𝗹𝗲 𝗛𝗗𝗕

Many Singaporeans think that buying the biggest HDB flat they can afford to be a smart decision: first, for future family planning and secondly, it's seen to make bigger capital gains later on. However, buying a smaller 3-room flat also has its benefits. We look at 7 reasons why this flat type could be an underrated choice.

This week, we tour a unique single-floor penthouse in Mt Sinai. It’s got the advantage of a quiet location, and this penthouse at Leighwoods comes in at a huge 4,919 square feet. There are 4 large bedrooms here, and it’s also a great option for entertaining as you have multiple dining places besides the main dining room. Another good thing is that the floor plate is split in half (like a dumbbell layout) so there is more privacy for the bedrooms as well.

This week, we visit a 5-room BTO unit at Tampines GreenVerge. Homeowners Terrence and Roxanne knew they wanted a dark theme, as they wanted something different from their previous home. The 5-room unit on paper was 1,216 square feet, but to them, it somehow felt smaller than their old 4-room flat. As a result, it required a lot of creative adjustments to configure the space for their living needs.

**Insider Tour

**In this episode, we tour the showflat at Lentor Modern! The new launch is the latest addition to Guocoland’s Modern series of standout developments, riding the coattails of the successful Martin Modern and Midtown Modern. While the latter 2 are both in prime CCR territory, surrounded by equally tall buildings or condos, the product here at Lentor Modern is admittedly quite different.

**Watch** ➡️ https://youtu.be/zWr6pjOwHe0

**Buying

**Anyone that has tried to buy a new launch recently knows how tedious and convoluted the process can be - which is astonishing considering the advances in technology today.

Today, we're releasing a new portal that we hope will make the process a lot more transparent and seamless.

Read on to find out how we aim to tackle some of these challenges, as well as our solutions to them.

𝗥𝗲𝗮𝗱 𝗡𝗼𝘄 ➡️ https://stackedhomes.com/editorial/7-reasons-why-buying-a-new-launch-is-a-pain-today-why-we-built-a-new-platform/

𝗡𝗲𝘄 𝗟𝗮𝘂𝗻𝗰𝗵 𝗥𝗲𝘃𝗶𝗲𝘄𝘀

This is our review of Lentor Modern, a 99-year leasehold new launch along Lentor Central.

Lentor Modern will likely be a game-changer to this area, breathing new life with a mall of its own and 25-storey towers that will soar above every building close by (for now, at least). It's also an integrated development with direct connectivity to Lentor MRT (TEL). Couple this with the lack of supply in the area, and the development seems to have all the ingredients of a hot new launch.

So if you're in the market for a new launch property, should you consider Lentor Modern? Read the full review to decide for yourself!

𝗥𝗲𝗮𝗱 𝗡𝗼𝘄 ➡️ https://stackedhomes.com/editorial/lentor-modern-review/

This week, Reuben and  Aiken tour an inconspicuous cafe located at South Bridge Road. Named DAWN, it’s one of those spaces that iykyk, and for fans of that raw minimalist look you will definitely feel at home here. It’s not a huge space by any means, but that natural vibe here is very cosy indeed.

Besides the ambiance, the bakes are all done in-house by owner, Jane. For more on the space, please visit: https://www.instagram.com/dawnkissa/

Special thanks to Jane for hosting us and taking the time to show us around!

You may have heard of the "first mover advantage", in that if you're the first to buy into a "yet-to-peak" area, you'd be paid off handsomely later on. After all, you are taking a bigger risk at the start before the area becomes more developed.

Well, that's in theory. What does that look like based on historical data? In this article, we look at 4 developments to see how they have performed over time and what that means for you.

For those looking to stay in a landed home in the east, you may have heard of the Frankel estate. The estate ranks relatively high when it comes to public transport, and its amenities are not too shabby either (there are two malls located nearby). However, the houses here don't come cheap - the lowest on offer at this time of writing is $5 million. Join TJ as she tours this landed enclave and shares her thoughts on the area!

**Living In

**This week, we visit an architect’s very own multi-generation family home that’s been named “Open House”. Architect couple Gwen and Berlin who are one half of the founding team at Formwerkz Architects, had to design a home around their young son, and their parents. 

From the outside, it’s hard to tell how the name of the home came about. But once you step through the home, you’ll soon understand why as the home was designed in an open nature to facilitate the different living spaces of the home, yet allow for privacy for members of the family.

𝗧𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺𝗮𝗸𝗲𝗿𝘀

This week, it’s back to the East again as Reuben and  Aiken visit a very unique cafe in Siglap. Owner Heikal opened the Moroccan-inspired restaurant La Fez Bakery & Cafe, and has gone full out to ensure that when you step in, you’d almost feel like you’ve been transported to a cafe in Marrakesh. From the pink hues, to the palm trees, gold accents, and of course, that unique horseshoe arch at the entrance, it’s all very different from the typical cafe scene that you’d see in Singapore. Even the plates, trays, and accessories are all imported from Morocco to keep it authentic. 

Special thanks to Heikal for taking the time to show us around La Fez! For more, you can visit: https://www.instagram.com/wearelafez/

𝗦𝘁𝗮𝗰𝗸𝗲𝗱 𝗜𝗻-𝗛𝗼𝘂𝘀𝗲

This week, we tour a bright and airy 1,572 square feet duplex condo unit at Suites at Orchard. It’s got a convenient location just outside Plaza Singapura and The Atrium @ Orchard - which means that besides shopping and eating, you have nearly immediate access to 3 MRT lines (North East, North South, Circle). 

It was built by developer Allgreen Properties in 2015, and has a total of just 118 units. 

The unit itself is a 3 bedroom 3 bathroom duplex condo, with one bedroom set on the first floor, and the other two bedrooms on the second. While there is already a balcony on the first floor, the master bedroom has a balcony too.
